page.title: 10VILLAGE STUDY-EATON.
page.content: {EATON}IS A PARISH AND A SMALL BUT PLEASANT VILLAGE ON THE RIVER IDLE.THE VILLAGE ITSELF IS SITUATED ON HIGHER GROUND AND DERIVES ITS NAME FROM THE RIVER,THAT IS IDLETON OR EATON.OLDER RESIDENTS REMEMBER THE SERIOUS FLOODING OF 1958 AND COMMENTED ON THE FACT THAT THE SAXONS HAD CHOSEN WELL. THE RIVER HAD BECOME A LAKE YET THE VILLAGE,HALL AND CHURCH WERE SAFELY ABOVE THE FLOOD WATERS.{ {HISTORY}EATON VILLAGE WAS MENTIONED IN {THE DOMESDAY BOOK}OF 1086 AND IT WAS ALREADY A FLOURISHING VILLAGE HAVING BEEN SETTLED IN EARLIER DAYS BY ANGLO-SAXONS WHO CAME UP THE TRENT AND THE IDLE.IN 1066 HISTORY TELLS US THAT IT CHANGED HANDS BEING TAKEN FROM THE TEN ANGLO-SAXON THEGNS WHO OWNED IT AND GIVEN TO A NORMAN KNIGHT CALLED ROGER DE BUSLI A FRIEND OF WILLIAM THE CONQUERER.
